title: Peace of Mind
review: This place is located some 10 km from mall road , it's on slightly on off beaten path and last 2-3 km road is slightly narrow but motorable. This is private property with entrance fee of RS 100, there is one small museum in the starting and adjacent to that an open canteen. From the canteen a small pathway goes toward the echo and valley view point which is the most beautiful spot of this place. Its very quiet and relaxing there for spending some time.

title: Great but unknown place
review: This place was made almost 170 year back but englishman. There is a small museum and good outdoor activities to be done like valley and echo point. We walked all the way from library and we were just happy to walk all the way and walk back. There is small forest on the way and it is recommended to go by car if you cannot walk

title: Good place
review: The place is very natural and has some good natured view of beautiful landscape. Definitely a place to visit

title: weekend trip
review: very cool nice place. must spend some time during your morning or evening walk. substantially clean and very green all around.

title: Beatiful
review: Try Seegreen Cafe for good coffee, hot chocolate and sandwiches. Perfect to sit in the sun and read a book

title: Nature come on earth
review: We got more with different creatures nice place with birds and monkey totally memorable place I love it

title: nice nature! Quite place, monkeys and birds!
review: nice nature! Quite place, monkeys and birds! You can reach this nature reserve walking, car, motobike, bike...

title: Cloud end life start
review: We meet nature with beautiful environment and enjoyed with beautiful and taste coffee I like much this memories

title: An Average Place to Visit!
review: We traveled there last weekend and found the place missed the wow factor. The drive was good with some steep patches. The road is narrow and needs skill if you have to pass another car. The view is great but similar vies are there from almost everywhere in Mussoorie. There is one museum at Cloud's End which was closed at the time of our visit.

title: A very average place
review: only name is good...can be avoided...nothing is there to be seen....it is on the same way of George everest so tourist just go there otherwise it is avoidable

title: Way of falls
review: This is new experience regarding to that and unquie feeling I like the environment and place and most important is cloud

title: solitude
review: my advice is that you walk upto this place...it is basically a private place where you can stay...it has a restaurant as well...it is a place for you if serenity is what you are looking...you can admire the nature for hours...most of the time the place is covered in mist...

title: Visit for the View
review: Cloud's End, located on Hathipaon Road, is worth visiting for the amazing views. It is a calm and peaceful place.

title: awesome veiws
review: its worth a visit if you love nature coz its far from main mussoorie town , there is a private resort where u can stay, it was closed when we visited but you can pay a ticket of Rs 50.00 and enter the public areas including echo point

title: Avoid it
review: It's a private resort, which isn't functional and in poor state. It's far from the mall road. They charge Rs50 per head for the entry. There seem to be two points; view point and echo point. Difficult to reach either of them because of the poor maintenance. Don't advise to go.

title: Avoid it !!
review: This is a must avoid place. You'll be charged ₹50 for no mean. It's a private property with poorly maintained. You'll only be able to see two fake points: echo point and view point.

title: Avoidable
review: A private resort and entry fees charged. Nothing much to see, except for an echo point and some scenery. One can see better scenery from many places in Mussoorie. Not worth taking the trouble to reach there.

title: Far from the mall road
review: We took sometime to discover this place. Nice place, have several spots offering spectacular view. This place is accessible with tempo traveler too.

title: Good Scenic View
review: Its is Private Resort. They Charge Rs50/- for entry. You can see Few 18th and 19 th century items[museum]. There is 1 point Echo point. good Scenic place.

title: Beautiful!!!
review: Go there for the scenic beauty.. it’s quiet and lovely ... There is an echo point there but as there was a lot of wind there was no echo but we witnessed hail !!

title: Heavenly View
review: Here you can have nice view of the most prestigious mountains of The Country India. Do visit with family and friends.

title: Wow place
review: This is the beautiful property in uttrakhand . If u love nature then this is the best nature's heaven on earth. The weather changes every hour naturally. And the points and veiws from cloud end ar marvellous beautiful awesome.... really we had very good time there .

title: Just Visit Once
review: Just a stunning view and nothing else

title: Haven !
review: Never imagined I would feel like this when I started for this place .... it's just... clouds end...u r at a great height... it's almost a single road to this place with many steep roads...... but a must visit for people who love nature and peaceful environment...... it's a private place.... food is gud but limited.....natural beauty is immense

title: Magical views!
review: It is a really amazing place worth a visit.Looking for nature then please do visit. Spend some time with yourself peacefully.

title: Best
review: Loved this place, if you are here don't miss this place. Lovely place like heaven on earth, clouds everywhere and bit cold, good photography also

title: not worth it
review: if you are booking a taxi and going well it is not worth it, unless you love walking in the wilderness, and please make sure to take a taxi round trip as you will not get a taxi on your way back

title: Enjoyed the trek to Cloud's End
review: We were two women travellers who trekked to Cloud's End and totally enjoyed the long walk. Cloud's End is a private property and one can get in by buying a ticket which is Rs 50/- per head. It has an echo point and another point that offers a nice view of the hills and the valleys. Even the walk through the jungle upto Cloud's End from Seegreen Cafe is enjoyable. Though one can go up there in a car, I would recommend trekking.

title: Scenic view
review: It's a rough drive up to Clouds End, but the views enroute are beautiful and the solitude and peace makes one want to whisper.

title: Secluded and peaceful
review: Road trip from Massourie mall road to Cloud's End was amazing. We booked a taxi and started @1pm. We reached there in an hour or so. The best part of road trip was greenery all along the path. While returning we made a stop at a Maggie shop in the wilderness. People from mountains are friendly. We got time to spend with few Stray dogs. We also interacted with a herd of sheep :)

title: Splendid view
review: Do peaceful place for nature lover and if you love walking, you can take view of foggy mountain and go on long walk

title: Good views away from the maddening crowd
review: Cloud's End is located about 20-25 mins from Library Chowk.  It has great views as is away from the crowds of Mussoorie.  You can see the mountains far away and even the snow covered peaks if it is a clear day.

title: Lover's Point
review: Perfect for couples, dating, and picnic etc

title: Nice Place
review: It is a great location on top of the hill, intact it is a cliff and it is no crowd there as not many people go there, it also has an amazing view of the valley. place to take lot of selfies and pictures.

title: Not worth it!
review: First of all, you can't go to this place offseason as you won't find anyone visiting that place. Second of all, it's not a family place that you can go with your car or taxi. We went with our bike and regretted it. Very desolate and deserted place.

title: Nice place to visit in Mussorie
review: Firstly, I want to mention that my review is based on the Cloud's end resort location. If you hire a local sightseeing cab from any of the Mussorie taxi stand they will take you here only. They will drop you in front of a resort named Cloud's End and you have to purchase entry tickets worth INR50 to enter. Inside the resort there's a trail of around 400-500 meters to reach an echo point and a view point of the mountains. The place is not that big but the view and the walk is nice.

title: Hathipaon.
review: You can get a good view of the valleys and hills of Mussoorie from here but nothing so spectacular as to mark it out from the other areas of Mussoorie. However you can trek for about two kilometres from here through neat forest to the George Everest House.

title: Good place
review: It is a beautiful place to capture good photographs. Good for a nature lover. We loved the view and it was excellent. This place is inside Resort named Cloud's End. There is an entry ticket to visit this place. If you have got enough time then you can visit this place.

title: Nice view
review: Actually it was raining. So could not enjoy much. Also road was muddy and sliipery. Otherwise its very beautiful when sky is clear.

title: Resort in wilderness
review: The place is a bit difficult to reach but has excellent panaromic views of the mountains. Hiking upto the point was worthwhile.

title: Worth the view
review: We went there for a short visit. The place is a little away from the town of Mussoorie and the 20 mins drive is so worth the effort. The property is behind mountains and beyond meandering roads & clusters of trees. It’s not a very fancy resort however very comfy & cozy. They have an amazing view of the valley & a breathtaking view of the snow clad mountains.

title: A Pristine Hillside for Nature Lovers !
review: A very scenic and pristine place on the western outskirts of Mussoorie. Clouds End is located around 7 km from the Mussoorie mall road. It is a great place for short walks, nature trail and MTB tours. Clouds End still retains the charm of unspoilt mountain beauty unlike many other tourist spots. It is also a starting point for the Benog hill trek which is the best day hike in the Mussoorie region. One can see the Benog Tibba peak towards the north all the way from Hathipaon to Clouds End. Clouds End is also a starting point for Bhadraj Forest trek which is an adventurous full day trek. Clouds End is a highly recommended place to sooth your senses !

title: Simply beautiful
review: One of the most visit place in mussorie. It's calm, serene and simply beautiful. Just go relax and enjoy.

title: Offbeat Location
review: Heritage property , offbeat and away from hustle and crowd. Greenery and Natural surroundings. The food and hospitality is great.

title: Green view!!!
review: The place is very superb with greenery with lots of trees and plants. The climate was good. Nice place

title: Epitome of beauty
review: I was lucky enough to drive up to Cloud's end for Sunset! An absolutely fantastic and heart warming view indeed!

title: Don't Miss
review: If you stay at Mussoorie, please do not miss the Cloud's End. Besides the hills and snow range, you will experience the echo point.

title: HEAVEN
review: Best place to be near nature with the real aroma of freshness. Must visit the place it makes you fresh and Stamina Strong

title: Go off season and grin ear to ear ! It's you and nature !
review: The road is very narrow, through dense forest with many curves and gradients. I had seen the prayer flags but had no idea they were at the point, so now it's a great way to locate Cloud's End.

title: Deserted but very good
review: This is again an amazing view point, you can see similar mountains which you have seen from Lal tibba with extra view of the other side of mountains with cloud hanging low. We went here to watch sunset but since the place and road to Cloud's end was so deserted that we did not stop there till late. We hired cab, but people also took bike which would be challenging if any one has not much experience driving on narrow lanes and that too on mountain

title: Wonderful Place for Nature Lovers
review: If u are a nature lover and seek a calm, quiet and peaceful environment then I will recommend this place for you.

title: Excellent place with lots of greenery
review: The place is managed by 2 sisters,and they're doing a great task of managing the place,given the size of their estate!

title: Lovely greenery at this secluded area
review: This is a place with immense natural beauty in Mussoorie.

title: natural beauty
review: if you are nature lover then you should come here.this place not much crowdy as others place in mussoorie. you can spend 1 hour here but we liked this place and we spend 2.5 hours here

title: Nature lap
review: Oooooosssssmmmm place fr nature lovers...Hd wonderful tym there..bful mountains..Maggi point .. Wonderful place fr family picnic..

title: Beautiful place
review: The place is best for the friends and family , you will enjoy it any way

title: Divine Paradise
review: Tourists visiting this place can witness beautiful views and pleasant atmosphere.Tourists can witness variety of species of flora and fauna,while following the path to reach the attraction.

title: Very interest ing  attraction at one end of the Queen of Hills
review: Cloud’s End

title: natural and peaceful
review: there are nothing special but views was great. i liked this place. weather was great. it is not a must visit place but if you are natural lover you should visit here. not much crowed.

title: Great view of mountains and clouds
review: It is a resort which is visited by the people to look out for the clouds and the views of the Himalayan. The clouds sailing in the sky are so good to look at from the height at which the resort is located. Also, views of Himalayas is good from here.

title: Serene and scenic
review: I forgot all the day to day tensions , routines for a few moments . All I could think of was  just I and the nature . The place is breathtakingly vast with an amazing Himalayan view.

title: A very quiet and cool place to visit
review: Cloud's End is another private property ( stay and restaurant) which charges nominal entry fees. But the place is very nice and decently maintained. The approach road is through hilly forest and enjoyable. You can combine visit to George Everest's House and this place in the same trip. The Echo point is very cool and quite place, with good number of pine trees and breeze. Lots of opportunities to watch birds and take pictures. The restaurant is also nice, although we had only lemon Jaljeera there but it was very very refreshing. A must visit place for nature lovers.

title: Nice view of the valley
review: The place had it's main building locked up when we visited. Did not look well kept by the views from there are just breathtaking.

title: Good view point
review: Its a resort at a great location with great view points accessible with just a small walk around the resort. Since its a resort and not a public place one has to buy a ticket to move around the place. We took a short walk around it and found few points with good view and did some photography.

title: WOW views, amazingly peaceful
review: i could hear myself think and breathe....

title: Different, not your typical picnic spot
review: Nice for photo-shoots.

title: Lovely Valley views
review: Clouds end is a lovely view point in the queen of hills.

title: Do not confuse with Cloud end forest resort
review: Most people confuse this location with Cloud's end forest resort. The road actually forks in two directions. While travelling from Mussoorie do not take the road leading to the Cloud's end resort. Instead take the road on the left. From here it is about 2 kms to Cloud's end. The views from here are breathtaking. Few people come here and hence it is completely pristine and quiet. It is literally end of the land mass and you get great view of the valley from here. There is a small makeshift shop nearby where you can get tea and some light snacks.Must visit location for nature lovers

title: Nature at its best
review: you will find nature at its best at this place.  we loved the view and peace here.  the awesome weather and greenery is the best here.

title: End of the land mass touching the clouds
review: It is a must place to visit for all nature lovers. Totally quiet and serene place with a deep valley as view point. There is a Cloud end Resort on the way with a 400 mt trail leading to an echo point and view points. It is a beautiful property with a 19th century spacious house converted as a resort and a museum. A collection of antique furniture.

title: Serenity at its best
review: Was recommended as an area where lot of Rhododendron trees are. I have been to this place twice. Secluded place with an old bungalow from time of Raj rule. Outdoors there is a restaurant for visitors. Managed by a family. On my first visit youngsters from the family were enthusiastically serving clients. May be they had just opened the restaurant. food satisfactory. On my second visit there were very few people around. So enjoyed the solitude and surrounding nature. Unfortunately there were no flowering of Rhododendrons. If you are seeking for a quiet place for lunch this is it.

title: Just awesome
review: Cloud's End Overview. 6 km west off the Library, the Cloud's end marks the end of Mussoorie. It is covered by thick clouds all around looks very nice

title: An accelerating and adventurous place to visit
review: Clouds end is an excellent place for camping and hiking. Althouggh it is only 6 or 7 kms from the main Mussoorie city, it is so different, soothing and peaceful.

title: The Himalayain odyssey
review: The trek to Clouds End is not meant for the faint hearted and the unfit..... we walked more than 9 kms from Sterling to Clouds End once again (had trekked last year too)... and it is one of the best walks to undertake... on reaching the resort and sipping hot tea in the restaurant amidst pin drop silence and set in the middle of majestic mountain views, this was one of the highlights of our holiday.

title: Tall Pine Trees
review: The point offers nice view of clear blue sky and tall grown pine trees. The dense forest offers a view which is difficult to find out where the land ends

title: Scenic, peaceful
review: After paying 50 bucks at the gate, I was wondering whats in store inside the resort. It was not disappointing. I went to mussoorie for scenic, peaceful view thats exactly what I got. Its beautiful. If you are visiting mussoorie I'd recommend you make a stop here. There are no shops here and but there is one restaurant. The place is beautiful but also has monkeys. So be careful if you have eatables.

title: Excellent view point
review: Its a private property, entry fees applicable. Oldest Bunglow with Furniture, can be viewed from outside, partially converted into Hotel during season.  Mountain View point is very nice,

title: Amazing place to stay
review: I didnt stay there since it opens in march,but spent an entire day sitting in the balcony and watching the snow caps....very nice ambience

title: Enjoy in the wilderness...
review: One of the very few places in liked in mussorie. 7-8kms away from main city, the way itself is from a forest....scary or adventurous....depends on person.

title: Excellent place to hang out with friend
review: best place to go with friend, you can plan a day trip if staying in dehradun or mussoorie, the view are stunning if you are a selfie person the trip is a must ..

title: awsm view
review: this place is really awesome for it scenic view & quit , amazing  to see clouds from here is really something amazing which cannot be expressed in words .........

title: Scenic place
review: Its a scenic and  serene place . One can easily fall in love with the weather and scenic beauty of this place . Its away from the busy and polluted roads. And has fresh breeze . Its a nice place to visit with frnds and family . Good for canping and hiking .

title: Must Visit while at Mussoorie
review: Clouds End / George Everest is among the top 3 places to visit while at Mussoorie. There are adventure camps up there for the inclined. The road isn't good though. Not recommended for self-drive vehicles.

title: Nice area but garbage around
review: It is sad sometimes to see how tourists are so irresponsible and throw wrappers and plastic bags everywhere. This place would have been so much more beautiful without them.

title: Must visit
review: Also go for the Benog Tibba trek. There's nothing much to see in the Cloud's End Resort. Plus they charge you for entry, which is a waste.

title: Cloud's End - The name suits
review: Cloud's End - The name suits. Its really like you reach the clouds and feel that you can touch them,.

title: Amazing!!!
review: I just love this point. I had never seen such kind of place. It is on the top of the hill. Excellent view.

title: best place in mussoorie
review: this will be ur's top priority in mussoorie visit,

title: Peaceful place !
review: One of the peaceful place you will find in mussoorie ! As the name tells, you will find this    place as very scenic ,where you will find clouds near you !

title: Really at cloud's end
review: We expected cloud end's to be only a view point, like Lal Tibba. However, it is actually a resort which allows entry to tourists on its campus by charging an entry fee. The point offers a good view of the Himalayan range and the valley. However, i wish the view points were well maintained, as the the trail to the view point ends abruptly and cannot hold a large crowd. The views are further obstructed by trees and overgrowing vegetation.

title: Vew!!
review: True to its name this one of the tops, like George Everest, you should come see. The view is amazing. Top it up with a Chai and it feels heavenly.

title: End of Musoorrie
review: Said that this the end of Mussoorie. Bring out camera and click some amazing views of valley. Lots of trekking required to reach place.

title: very awesome place for peace and nature lover
review: woow what a lovely weather and lovely place for all kind of people just awesome must visited palace of mussrie

title: Great food in Cloud's End
review: Must try their homemade curry, what a memorable dish! The cafe is located at the end of the hill, where you can have the view of mountain greens and clouds.

title: Great views
review: Great views from the view point - we were lucky and the fog clear out for long enough for us to see.

title: Location
review: Not my type of abode to stay in but definitely go there for a drive, view, and a meal. The family who runs it are very warm and great people.

title: Great place with great views
review: I hiked here from Mall Road, took me about 2.5 hours. Really nice views during the hike too. You can enter the Cloud's End resort for a cover charge of Rs. 200 and redeem the money in the restaurant. If you just want to go around the resort and go to the view point, you can pay a one time Rs. 50 entrance fee. The food was good at the restaurant and the views are amazing too.

title: Cloud 9
review: Scenic beauty is what this place is for.  The place is at scary height. The roads looked difficult though it is tarmacced.

title: Nice Views. Decent food
review: We went there for lunch. The views are amazing. Place was clean and hygienic. Food as decent. Drive to the place was very nice with many spots on the way one could stop for a bit.

title: drive to haven
review: a great escape in clouds after a very tinny and one way traffic road and end to a good resorts for food and activities

title: Delightful visit
review: Nice place to visit.Bungalow has historical bacground. Dining area has views and quiet surrounding. There is a walk to ECHO point but I did not go. Sitting on benches outside the dining area and admiring nature is a very peaceful experience. It is a short visit but with lunch can be extended to 1/2 a day.

title: A must visit for nature lovers
review: Interested in nature than this is the place away from the crowds of mussourie town, the forest trail was tiring but rejuvenating, ventured and tried different areas and routes in the forest ,most loved through out my trip in these mountains of mussourie !

title: green and green
review: We enjoyed the greenery of Cloud's end, the echo point. Though it was surrounded by clouds that day, dun valley was visible. In  rainy day one can enjoy a cup of hot tea here.

title: eco point
review: cloud end is a amzing place

title: Heavenly
review: If you love nature and not the bazaars and crowds and eateries, then this is the place. You can do your soul searching. Be at endless peace with yourself , the surroundings will suck your stress and anxiety leaving you fresh and happy. That is if you love the nature!

title: Good Nature Trail
review: Though its a private property, however, worth a visit. Its a quite and serene place, which offers a good nature tail leading to echo points, breath taking valley views, clean and fresh air away from hustle bustle of Mussoorie main city.

title: Amaaaazingggg...........Awesome place for nature lovers
review: Visited the place for 2 days on 20th of June . The place is a heritage property located in a forest area . this is the only property in the area. Calm and Serene . Recommended for nature lovers.

title: Nice
review: Amazing place for nature lovers about 6-7 kms from library chowk . The roads are an adventure but definitely worth it

title: Scenic beauty
review: Topmost point of the hill having a small beautiful scenic beauty and perfect cosy weather. A small cottage also present incase somebody wants to spend night over there. It is an old property of royal family converted to tourist attaction. A museum having collections of antiques is also present which is worth watching.

title: Must visit,Go early morning
review: The road leading upto the place is very beautiful with dense greenery on both sides. I Visited late afternoon so could not see much birds but the ride was fantastic. It can be best enjoyed on foot , esp by people having interest in Birds.Nice serene place little away from hustle bustle of mussourie town. No idea abt the resort n food there though as i didn avail it.

title: Great food with view
review: It's a private property with Rs 200 per person coverage charge that can be settled against food in case you have it. Good place away from city's hustle bustle.

title: Good view but nothing much to do!
review: Clouds end is a very popular destination, which is suggested by a lot of guides. It is a good 12 kms away from mall road,we booked a car for the entire day as it was more economical.

title: The abode of clouds
review: This is the highest point in the Mussourie district which gives an amazing view of the Doon Valley, Yamuna River and the town of Mussoorie. This give an blissful approach of nature which is just a pleasure to the eyes.

title: Best and great place
review: If you like to be in woods, it is the place for you, wonderful scenery. A destination for biking. I visited the way upto Cloud End Resort and that was too good. The roads were covered with fog, making a very romantic atmosphere. Just loved this place. Best place in my opinion in Mussoorie.

title: Far from the madding corwd
review: Far away from the hustle and bustle of Mussoorie city, this is the real deal. The drive through the estate is exhilarating. The views are great...hills as far as you can see. Not very popular and so this still retains its rustic charm.

title: Cloud end - Tip of Mussorrie
review: The Cloud End is a heritage home near Mussoorie that offers 250 degrees Himalayan views and is surrounded by reserve forest and is excellent for walks and bird watching.

title: The border feel.
review: Clouds end is in the indo-tibetian border.You can see military guard points on the way. The view is very nice. The way to clouds end is very interesting( Raw dense forest area).

title: Nice Views and decent lunch
review: Found this place on Hotel Manager's recommendation and went there for lunch. Nice Resort in the jungle with some decent treks (which I couldnt fully avail since I had gone for lunch). The lunch was normal North Indian fair and fairly decent but one had gone in the hope of getting some local gadwalie flavours which was missing. For someone planning to stay there, it is pet friendly and fairly quiet so seems like a worthwhile get away place.

title: Just the name makes it woth a visit!
review: You will have a beautiful view of Doon Valley from here. I hope  tourist department in Dehra Dun will make something beautiful out of this place and restore Sir Everest house. Make a museum of it and not the circus that many torist attractions in India is turns into, perhaps you had better hurry there...

title: Beautiful Place
review: On the recommendation of few local we had visited the place and to tell you its one of the best visit of ours in the city. Excellent place to take pictures and spend few hours

title: Heaven in mussorie
review: We were bored to visit the highly commercialized areas like kempty falls and  gunn hill and on recommendation of hotel manager we went to clouds end. We found the view mesmerising and enjoyed there for 2 hours. This was one of best places in mussoeie

title: Best place in mussorie to visit
review: This was the best place to visit for us, not too popular, its made in 1858. It's gothic architecture at the peak of a hill with outstanding view of valley and clouds. It has an echo point and a nice restaurant in summer you can literally touch the clouds .

title: Simply Peace
review: Located away from the hustle bustle of the city, this place is ideal for peace lovers, gives immense internal energy to the travelers.

title: Peace in heaven
review: Its beautiful place for people who loves peace and meditation. Nature is calling you to leave everything behind and just be in the moment. We were not lucky to see clouds where they end))) however no regrets for coming to that place. Love it!

title: Away from the maddening crowd
review: Lovely views. Peace. Quiet. Forests. Gorgeous trees. Cool mountain breeze. The drive there is lovely. The place is even better! A must visit!

title: "Good and enjoyable place"
review: A very nice place to visit away from the crowds. However the road to the top is narrow and very steep. Travel with only experienced drivers.

title: For those who love mountainering
review: Its a quite place,away from the busy town and cities calming the person.

title: Great View
review: Its a difficult drive up but one that is well worth it just for the view. The walk at the end to the viewing point can be difficult if you are not fit.

title: Nice place but to be visited in Winters...
review: Nice place around 10kms from mussorie have to be visited by taxi only due to very steep climbing. Near it there are George Everest which is better than this...

title: Pollution free and worth a visit
review: Place is little difficult to reach but worth visiting. It is very isolated from the main Mussoorie, you will see very few people at Cloud's End Resort, it was totally pollution free, very natural, with great view of clouds, mountains and forests. Totally worth to visit.

title: worth going
review: we were very hesitent in visiting clouds end but once we went there we knew exactly that this is the place to enjoy nature in silence....   what amazing views walking in the clouds

title: Wonderful Views
review: Clouds end is that part of Mussoorie which is far from the maddening crowd...It takes a little effort to get there as the roads are a little bumpy.

title: Excellent place
review: If you have a private vehicle, then this is a must visit place where you can see beautiful mountain ranges

title: Must must visit
review: Not more people visit these place but it should not be in the top list in your visit to mussoorie...as clouds will be passing by the mountain.....the view is super ausumn....must visit....

title: scenic
review: what views u get from here.. stunning and worth coming here.. its approx 6 kms away from mussoorie but will leave u awefilled

title: Superb location
review: I loved Cloud's End spot. It is indeed the end on top of the mountains and you can walk amidst the clouds, literally. It is at an altitude of 7000 feet and the drive to spot is beautiful. On one hand is the entire range of Himalayan snow peaks and on the other, there are green hills down below. So you overlook over the green hills on your left as you approach the spot and the mesmerizing view of snow peaks on your right never stop to amaze you. The hotel over there is a well kept beautiful attraction, the road to which gets closed during heavy snowfall. In that case, one has to trek and come up.

title: " Difficult To Reach But Worth Visit "
review: It is about 6 kms away from Mussoorie but the awesome views leave you simply stunning. You will see clouds passing by the mountains. Some times you get wet due to mist of these clouds.

title: undeveloped place
review: 6 kms from mussoorie.A peak point but poorly managed.Not advisable to visit alone.Very poor road conditions to reach this point and no public transportation for this place.

title: The Best Place In Mussoorie
review: If you are a nature lover you will find this place amazing.it is a little diificult to reach there but if you have your vehicle you can go there easily . Just search "clouds end hotel" on google maps and you are good to go.But don't go in the hotel ,that is just a restaurant . stop like 80-100 m before the hotel and the view you will get from there is just amazing.it is like walking in the clouds.There is nothing else there which is bad because it is a good place which should be developed.But going there is worth the difficulty.AND yes a maggi point is also there too.

title: What a view
review: A serene place affording lot of trekking opportunities. A memerising view of Doon valley. A decent approach. The lush forest and occasional glimpse of some exotic bird and forest sounds invigorate you.

title: Check if the road is open to Cloud's end
review: Please check whether the road to Cloud's end is open. When we reached nearly halfway there was road work going on and we couldn't proceed further by car. Also the restaurant at Cloud's end was closed( 24-25 Sep 2015)

title: picturely view
review: This place is about seven kilometer from library chowk musoorie.it is nice to see the view .one can visit here once.

title: last point of the Mussoorie Hills..Awesome view
review: Nice Ambience.. Good food lovely weather clean fresh air.. A Charming place with pleasant and gracious hosts

title: Amazing Place – Well Neglected
review: Our dear friend suggested this hideout otherwise popularly known as George Everest Hill which happens to be a secluded place housing this famous surveyor from UK George Everest in the early nineteenth century.

title: awesome view
review: we had an awesome view from this place. it was like we were in clouds.. loved every second we spend there

title: Super Beautiful and Adventerous
review: Now to get here you need a Good car or 2 wheeler, and a lot of climb but its all worth it. Its mesmerizing view of a valley just before the resort, cloudy and special when the sun is setting. The trees line up and shine as it decorated. Breezy, idyllic, couple, jungle, magical if you can be quiet and with nature.

title: Good view but very unclean
review: Water logging and lot of cows will greet you there. People who come for picnic ruin the place nicely.

title: Visitable and walkable
review: It is a good and visitable place. As name suggest it is a place of clouds and forests. A good restaurant is available here but the entry fees is Rs. 150/- per person which is not advisable. The environment and nature around is loveable and enjoyable. for trekking lover people the path between Hathi paaw and cloud's End is heaven as lot of landscapes beautiful valleys.

title: Nicely renovated
review: This old British House on the old hill route to Shimla is a nice spot for a quiet cup of tea while overlooking Benog Tibba and the snows. There are some adventure-type pursuits available. The old house was fixed up recently. There are plenty of semi-tents for camping and a restaurant, although very slow to serve. Sadly, the owners have found it necessary to charge a Rs 200 entrance fee per person. After the long drive out from library Bazaar, most would feel they needed to pay rather than return. The prices are high, trying to limit the clientele, I presume.

title: Wild Hill Country
review: More than 8,000 ft high, surrounded by tall conifers and offering an expansive view of the Shivalik range along one side. The peace and solitude along this trek is priceless.

title: Different from the usual but ordinary
review: Its a bit of a drive from the main Mussorie mall road. Its a good option if you haven't got anything much better to do but if you're going there with the expectation of being in the middle of clouds at the edge of the world then you will be sorely disappointed. Theres some good scenery but thats about it.

title: Beautiful place
review: Its one of the best destination of mussorie, for those who love nature , beautiful view   close to nature n not far from mall road. But recomnended to tske a local cab .

title: Good place to spend the day in peace
review: If you have a spare day at hand in Mussoorie, then head to this place. There is a British house with old furniture and books like old copies of readers digest. A small eatery also operates inside the premises for some snacks. In winters come here to laze under the sun with an interesting book. Thats all about it. Some good views of the mountains could also be seen.

title: Can be skipped.
review: It's a so so place, quite far from the city. Have to take a cab up there. There is just a restaurant and the trees covered up most of the views.

title: true to the name
review: I was raining during my visit, so could not get the famous view from there. well approached by walk as well.

title: Place to echo
review: This is one of the best place to take a picture...we sat over here ,it's a peaceful place...Make a sound and you get back the echo 3-5 times from mountains...ohhh that's really interesting experience we had ....will miss forever ...Go for it...

title: Best place in Musoorie/Dehradun, Quite, Nature
review: Visited twice , and both time it was astonishing experience, This place is named after the person who searched Mount Everest.

title: Nature at best
review: Approach is offbeat - but won't regret once there. Service and accommodation needs upgrade. Can be made a great location of tourist and nature lovers.

title: picknick spot
review: just go there and check the clouds near you so close to u just touch the clouds wt a romantic location....!!!! vow....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: a piece of history
review: The old cottage can accommodate a few visitors for a night in a "museum". Simple friendly staff serves nice food. Sometimes people stay also in tents there. But one HAS to visit for the view.

title: free walk
review: for people who loves walking on hills. no shop/restaurant on the way. theres one resort which was under renovation in nov. u need to pay entry fee even if u done at their restaurant. found it weired though.

title: beautiful
review: enjoy a nice romantic walk... or just it there and read a book.. or simply admire the nature.. beautiful place surrounded by clouds... :)

title: Himalyas Top View
review: The Jungle view with small paths. Awesome view of himalyas peak view, tops covered with snow..............

title: really in nature
review: clouds end the historical place in mussoorie around 13 kms from library mussoorie it has a beautiful British bungalow to rejuvenate the  busy life of yours

title: Avoid at all costs. Rude staff and a nothing at all place.
review: Avoid at all costs. Rude staff and a nothing at all place.

title: Beautiful place
review: It looks you are on a mountain and clouds have come down to you. Very scenic place. Go during day time about 1-3 pm so the views are clear.

title: Beautiful
review: Worth going here for sure even the ride here is really nicegood views from here too This is probably a must do for travellers from cities evn better than thge lal tibba

title: Lovely quiet place
review: Beautiful views and trek path. nice restaurant as well. Secluded place, peaceful and quaint. View of the himalayas on a good weather day !

title: just  beautiful
review: Its  just nature,  good  drive  , and then at  end,  there s a cliff  and  huge valley,    there  is also  one small  dhaba , and nothing else,  very good for  camping,  and  picnics.  its  just  out of  the world.

title: super nice
review: very good views & definitely worth a visit.. its different from the usual sightseeing tours one normally takes when visiting mussorie.

title: Small trip
review: Better to avoid.....merciful roads.....charging of rs25 by the cloud end hotel for useless view......better to go george forest

title: We don't appreciate our history
review: On this place is standing dirty, dung filled ruins of home of sir George Everest, surveyor general of India. Most wall are in good condition. It is situated on most picturesque location of musoorie. Road leading to it is also nice. I felt sorry to see the condition of the ruins. Visit if you are interested in history of India.

title: Amazing Location. Quiet and serene
review: Offbeat. Not crowded. Great place to trek and walk around and enjoy nature. need to take a cab to reach the place but its really worth it. perfect for bird enthusiasts and photographers alike.

title: Cloud End
review: Excellent lanscape and you can view the entire range of mountains there.Very nice and soothing place if you want to get to a lonely place away from the crowd.

title: Amazing Place For Natural Beauty & Serenity
review: An amazing place for those seeking serenity and oneness with nature. Though its called Clouds End, the clouds never seem to end here......you can find them enveloping you all through the day ! It's a 400 acre private forest, surrounded by the Benog Wildlife reserve. Hence it has been spared the mindless destruction that is the sad story of the rest of Mussoorie.

title: Scenic Beauty
review: After travelling such a distance we were unable to view the snow covered mountains because of the mist.

title: Pure Flora & Fauna
review: It’s just pure flora & fauna; a good drive and huge valley. Also there is one small dhaba. Good for camping and picnics.

title: Difficult to reach but worth visiting
review: Clouds end is a hotel as well now. The road to reach this place is narrow and steep climb. If you are not used to driving in hills better take a Taxi.  Once you get there it is a beautiful place surrounded by dense forest. Old british charm and a very small meuseum. There is a n Echo point just 50 metres from the building. Take a walk relax and enjoy.

title: A must visit in mussoorie
review: This place is beyond explanation. You have to be there in real to witness how beautiful the forest is. One of the oldest building in mussoorie converted into a hotel is only for the lucky ones who want to experience serenity. The sunrise in winters with a sip of tea and yoga with the dew around is mesmerising. Icing on the top is homelike food cooked to order by the caring chef.

title: Hire a cab or take your own car. enjoy the place
review: Hidden and lesser known tourist attraction of Mussoorie is must visit. The property is private turned into hotel. Buy entry ticket and enjoy the place and shout at the echo point. good for stay also.Well maintained. Have Pakora's and tea.

title: A must visit - still largely unexplored, nature and views
review: This is still largely unexplored part of Mussoorie. The best part is George Everest's residence on the way to Cloud's End. This is a place not to be missed.

title: Friendship with nature
review: This place is set amid-st a private property and very well maintained. Its close to nature and many people don't go here and one can be very sure of awesome scenery around. They have some adventure sports facility too.

title: Approach Road Under Repair
review: It is nice place to be in the lap of nature. The road just after 1km from the Convent of Jesus and Mary School is under repair making it impossible for the four wheelers to pass. It is not a place that you will regret if missed to visit.

title: Cloud's End
review: Its a good view point and have nice treckking from there. it is behing Library and is twards a peaceful zone of mussoorie. Its gud if u want peace and natural beauty.

title: Nothing really...
review: There's nothing really at cloud's end, except a room which they call the 'museum', a filthy restaurant and an echo-point... at best it's a run-down facility with a lot of squandered potential.

title: Touch and feel the clouds
review: Romantic place for new couples to become naughty when cloud touches both of you and envelopes you.

title: Worth seeing despite bad road
review: This is a tourist attraction so why is this road so bad? A hellish experience indeed. The view itself is breathtaking but  then you have to return on the same awful road. Travelling there by an SUV or an Ambassador taxi would probably be  the best way to go. The run down restaurant takes away some of the charm.

title: Looks Like Earth Is Meeting With Clouds
review: This is an excellent place but the road to reach here is very bad... even though, this place is worth seeing... The view from here is brilliant...

title: Nice ViewPoint
review: The Cloud's End hotel is undergoing a renovation, and the zipline etc were not up. However, its a nice view point...

title: Great place to be
review: We trekked till there, me and my wife. The view is amazing and you are suddenly above clouds.

title: Enchanting
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie with excellent views.Must visit  Place for who loves adventures as you have many activities here. The road beside Fortune hotel on Mall road takes you to clouds end. The red flowers on the mountain adds color to the place. Cloud end is actually a forest resort which was one of the oldest building in Mussoorie. The resort is now famous for its activities and museum. The rooms are not maintained properly now. Its good place for enjoying activities and  valley view.

title: Good place to visit
review: I have visited thus place with my family as there s a adventure camp for those who are interested. I liked the echo point and is a highest peak in this area.

title: Nice views but a long walk
review: In case you are planning to walk to the clouds end from the main city centre, that is the mall road, it can be a very long walk. The views and scenery from there is beautiful but the service facilities there are quite poor.

title: Most BEAUTIFUL place in Mussoorie to visit!
review: Visited this place on a family trip to mussoorie and it turned out to be the most enchanting one. It is far from the city in the lap of nature and offers and amazing view of the valley-different view from each point. Echo point was good and you could actually hear the echo. It is basically a forest resort but not good enough if one wants to stay since the rooms are quite old and not properly maintained,though the renovation will start next month. There are many adventure activities around that place. It is quite less crowded. We also had some great freshly prepared food for lunch. And since it'd started raining while we were there,it made the whole thing even more mesmerising. The way to resort is quite steep so take a van or ambassador taxi.
